jobs.title: Inside Business Developer - Payments Network (L.68/99)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
📢 Promuoviamo la Diversità: Invitiamo le persone con disabilità a candidarsi! (L.68/99) 🚀

Questo ruolo fa parte del nostro impegno a promuovere un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo. Per questo motivo, Satispay dedica questa specifica opportunità a persone con disabilità o appartenenti ad altre categorie protette, in conformità con la legge italiana sulla tutela dell’occupazione (L.68/99). Accogliamo candidature da persone con ogni tipo di percorso.

Inside Business Developer - Payments, Napoli

Chi siamo
Satispay è nata per rivoluzionare i pagamenti quotidiani, rendendoli semplici, giusti, e alla portata di tutti. Ora guardiamo ancora più in alto, con l'obiettivo di plasmare il futuro del denaro. Siamo un movimento che sostiene milioni di persone. E abbiamo appena iniziato. Ci muoviamo con velocità, pensiamo con audacia e ci fidiamo gli uni degli altri per sfidare lo status quo, imparando e crescendo lungo il percorso. Se non sei solo alla ricerca del tuo prossimo lavoro, ma vuoi partecipare alla costruzione di qualcosa di grande impatto, fianco a fianco con un team di talenti, sei nel posto giusto.

Di cosa ti occuperai
In qualità di Inside Business Developer - Payments, svolgerai un ruolo chiave nell'acquisizione di nuove attività commerciali, promuovendo l'utilizzo di Satispay Business come soluzione di pagamento. Ecco cosa farai in una giornata-tipo:

  • Scouting, contatto e acquisizione – Convincendo nuove attività commerciali ad aderire al SuperNetwork Satispay.

  • Promozione della soluzione Satispay Business – Contattando, tramite attività outbound, gli esercenti nelle aree geografiche assegnate per convincerli a registrarsi.

  • Gestione di trattative – Utilizzando le tue capacità di comunicazione e negoziazione per ingaggiare e convertire efficacemente ogni cliente in tempi brevi.

  • Gestione CRM – Gestendo in autonomia il funnel di acquisizione su CRM Hubspot, rispettando gli standard di compliance richiesti.

  • Sviluppo capacità di comunicazione e negoziazione – Per promuovere efficacemente la soluzione di pagamento Satispay presso le attività commerciali. Aspettati sfide, collaborazione e la libertà di dare vita alle tue idee. Qui le cose cambiano rapidamente, quindi preparati ad adattarti, a prendere iniziativa e a dare forma al tuo ruolo mentre cresciamo.

Chi stiamo cercando
Cerchiamo qualcuno con la stoffa del problem-solver, che ami lavorare in team e mettersi all'opera. Se sei una persona curiosa e non hai paura di prenderti responsabilità, sei esattamente chi vogliamo nel nostro team. Ti ci vedi?

  • Intraprendenza – Con la voglia di mettersi in gioco e crescere professionalmente nel Business Development.

  • Doti relazionali – In grado di instaurare un rapporto di fiducia positivo e professionale con molteplici interlocutori.

  • Capacità persuasive – Dimostrando un alto grado di sicurezza nell’approcciare e ingaggiare potenziali nuovi prospect tramite chiamate.

  • Orientamento all’obiettivo – Con un mindset goal-oriented, motivato da obiettivi chiari, quantificabili e sfidanti, e gratificato dal raggiungerli.

  • Esperienza pregressa in ambito commerciale – Preferibilmente in ruoli di sviluppo business o vendite, con una forte attitudine all'acquisizione clienti. Non preoccuparti se non spunti tutte le caselle di questo elenco. Crediamo nel potere dei punti di vista e di forza di ognuno. Insieme stiamo costruendo qualcosa di speciale, e la tua prospettiva potrebbe essere l’elemento chiave che ci manca. Se sei una persona motivata e sai di poter fare la differenza, ti invitiamo a candidarti.

I benefit che avrai con noi
Crediamo fermamente che un grande impegno, sforzo e impatto meritino di essere ricompensati e supportati al meglio. Ecco perché abbiamo creato Satispay CareAbout, il nostro modo di assicurarci che tu abbia tutto il supporto necessario per il tuo benessere, la tua crescita e le tue finanze: 

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout: salute e benessere

  • Ferie illimitate

  • Congedo parentale esteso

  • Permessi per l’assistenza ai figli

  • Sistema di lavoro ibrido flessibile

  • Supporto psicologico e webinar con Serenis 

📚 CareAbout crescita e sviluppo

  • Programmi di sviluppo professionale

  • Programma di mobilità interna

  • Corsi di lingua con Preply

  • Esperienze di job shadowing

  • Workshop e training interni 

💰 CareAbout: supporto finanziario

  • Stipendio competitivo

  • Budget extra per Flexible Benefit

  • Buoni pasto

Pari opportunità
In Satispay, siamo fieri di essere un’azienda che offre pari opportunità. Celebriamo la diversità e l'inclusione, accogliendo individui di tutti i background. Questa opportunità è aperta a tutti, indipendentemente da razza, colore, religione, sesso, identità di genere, orientamento sessuale e nazionalità. Unisciti a noi in un ambiente di lavoro dove tutti sono i benvenuti!

Scopri di più su di noi
I nostri valori e i nostri pilastri non sono solo belle parole su una pagina, ma plasmano davvero tutto ciò che facciamo. Esplorali qui. 

Ti sembra il posto giusto per te? Fantastico!
Ci piacerebbe conoscere la tua storia.

#LI-Hybrid 

#LI-GA1

jobs.title: ICT Third Party Management Specialist (Luxembourg)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
ICT Third Party Management Specialist

Please note that this opportunity requires relocation to our Luxembourg office.

About Satispay
Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money. We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we’re just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go. If you’re looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you’re in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As a Third Party Management Specialist, you’ll play a key role in ensuring the resilience and security of our ICT infrastructure. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Process management – Lead the definition, documentation, and continuous improvement of the Group’s ICT Third-Party Management processes.

  • Regulatory compliance – Ensure all ICT third-party contractual frameworks comply with regulations like DORA, outsourcing guidelines, and other financial sector obligations.

  • Risk & governance – Support risk assessments, contribute to the identification and mitigation of associated risks, and help with the oversight and reporting on ICT third-party relationships to the Management Body.

  • Stakeholder guidance – Advise and guide stakeholders across Satispay to ensure a consistent understanding and application of third-party management policies.

  • Training & awareness – Design and deliver training programs to raise awareness of third-party risk management requirements, with a strong emphasis on DORA compliance.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who we’re looking for

We need a problem-solver who loves teamwork and gets things done. If you're curious and ready for real ownership, you'll fit in! Does this sound like you?

  • Relevant experience – At least 4 years of proven experience in Vendor, Third-Party, and/or Outsourcing Management, preferably within the financial services sector.

  • Regulatory knowledge – A solid understanding of EU regulations on ICT third-party risk, with a particular emphasis on the Digital Operational Resilience Act (DORA).

  • Risk management – Practical experience with risk management and internal control frameworks, including implementation or oversight responsibilities.

  • Communication skills – Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English (mandatory); proficiency in Italian is a strong advantage.

  • Collaborative mindset – A strong ability to work effectively with colleagues from diverse backgrounds in an agile, fast-paced environment.

Our benefits & perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That’s why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis

  • Flexible hybrid working system

  • Extended parental leave

  • Childcare leave

📚 CareAbout growth & development

  • Professional development programmes

  • Internal mobility program

  • Language classes with Preply

  • Internal workshops & training

💰 CareAbout financial support

  • Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)

  • International relocation support

  • Competitive salary

  • Meal vouchers

Equal-Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn more about us

Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place?

Awesome! We’d love to hear your story.

#LI-GA1

#LI-HYBRID

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Associate Legal Counsel

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As an Associate Legal Counsel, you’ll be a core member of our Legal team, driving strategic initiatives across product development, regulatory compliance, and business operations. You’ll serve as the primary legal point of contact for investment and payment-related matters and will work closely with cross-functional teams, including Tech, Strategy, Marketing, Compliance, and other business stakeholders. Your role will involve providing strategic legal advice, fostering innovation, and ensuring regulatory compliance across Satispay’s diverse offerings. Here's what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Strategic advisory - Play the role of strategic product counsel throughout the lifecycle of new product and feature development, from ideation to market launch, ensuring alignment with Satispay’s goals and regulatory compliance.

  • Cross-team collaboration - Partner with business teams to create groundbreaking services by developing innovative legal solutions that balance business needs with risk management.

  • Legal drafting and negotiation - Draft and negotiate a wide range of agreements, including partnerships, vendor contracts, terms of service, and other customer-facing documentation.

  • Regulatory compliance support - Work closely with the Compliance department to ensure products and services align with applicable financial regulations, including those related to e-money, MiFID services, or similar frameworks. Assist in managing relationships with regulatory authorities.

  • Horizon scanning - Proactively monitor regulatory developments and emerging trends, assessing their implications for the business and ensuring timely adaptation to maintain compliance and support strategic objectives.

Who we’re looking for

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you’re detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you’ll fit right in! Does this sound like you?

  • Legal and financial background – You are a lawyer with at least 5 years of experience in advising on financial regulations and customer-facing products, ideally with experience in tech innovation applied to e-money or MiFID services.

  • Strategic and risk-based approach – You can take smart risks and provide strategic advice, aligning regulatory requirements with business objectives.

  • Product counseling – You can immerse yourself in the technical and product aspects with high curiosity and are willing to find innovative customer-facing features while balancing legal risks effectively.

  • Contract negotiation – You are skilled in drafting and negotiating complex agreements with a strong understanding of regulatory considerations.

  • Sound judgment - You are confident in making sound decisions even in situations of ambiguity or with incomplete information.

  • Communication skills – You possess excellent communication skills, enabling you to advise and influence senior management and engage diverse stakeholders effectively.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Staff Engineer

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money. We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started.

We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

Role Overview

As a Staff Engineer, you will be a key member of our cross-functional, agile team, reporting to the CTO. With a strong passion for making developers highly productive, you’ll influence our architecture and shape the technical vision and long-term strategy. Your hands-on role involves coaching and supporting team members, primarily using Java, to develop complex features. You will build products and features to enhance Satispay's payment system, taking ownership from conception to production. Our tech stack includes Linux, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Java, Jersey, Spring, DynamoDB, and AWS infrastructure. We use RESTful microservices on EC2, RDS/DynamoDB for persistence, S3 for storage, AWS Lambda for serverless functions, Kinesis, and ElasticSearch for log streaming.

Your mission:

  • Mentor and guide teams. Leverage your proven track record of mentoring engineers to provide technical leadership, fostering best practices in coding, testing, and automation while building a culture of collaboration, growth, and excellence.

  • Drive operational excellence. Set and maintain a high operational bar for yourself and the team, ensuring our world-class infrastructure and distributed systems deliver consistent reliability and performance.

  • Drive cross-Functional collaboration. Work closely with product managers, designers, and other stakeholders to align technical initiatives with business objectives and deliver cohesive, high-quality solutions.

  • Architect complex frameworks. Design and implement scalable, secure, and reliable architectures that support current and future product needs, ensuring the robustness of our platform.

  • Foster a strategic vision. Apply your strategic mindset to prioritize initiatives for maximum impact, contributing to the long-term technical vision of Satispay.


Your ideal profile:

  • Deep industry expertise. 10+ years developing and maintaining high-performance infrastructure and distributed systems, with a degree in Computer Science or related field. Extensive experience with Java architectures in cloud-based environments (AWS is a plus).

  • Proven technical leadership. Demonstrated track record of technical execution and technical leadership at consumer-focused companies, driving engineering excellence and delivering complex systems at scale.

  • Microservices and Agile methodologies. You are experienced with microservices infrastructure and Agile methodologies, driving the implementation of scalable, reliable, and efficient systems.

  • Focus on simplicity and quality. You have a preference for simple solutions and share our passion for operational excellence, ensuring robust and maintainable code.

  • Outstanding communication skills. Excellent interpersonal abilities with outstanding written and verbal communication skills. You can articulate complex technical concepts clearly and build trust with various stakeholders in a positive and professional way.

  • Strategic mindset. Strong sense of what to prioritize for maximum impact, balancing immediate needs with long-term technical vision.

  • Language proficiency. You are fluent in Italian and English.

  • Passion for FinTech or Startup environments. You thrive in dynamic, fast-paced settings and are enthusiastic about contributing to the growth and innovation of a FinTech or startup company.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Inside Business Development Support, Napoli - Part-time (L.68/99)

📢 Promuoviamo la Diversità: Invitiamo le persone con disabilità a candidarsi! (L.68/99) 🚀

Questo ruolo fa parte del nostro impegno a promuovere un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo. Per questo motivo, Satispay dedica questa specifica opportunità a persone con disabilità o appartenenti ad altre categorie protette, in conformità con la legge italiana sulla tutela dell’occupazione (L.68/99). Accogliamo candidature da persone con ogni tipo di percorso.

Chi siamo
Satispay è nata per rivoluzionare i pagamenti quotidiani, rendendoli semplici, giusti, e alla portata di tutti. Ora guardiamo ancora più in alto, con l'obiettivo di plasmare il futuro del denaro. Siamo un movimento che sostiene milioni di persone. E abbiamo appena iniziato. Ci muoviamo con velocità, pensiamo con audacia e ci fidiamo gli uni degli altri per sfidare lo status quo, imparando e crescendo lungo il percorso. Se non sei solo alla ricerca del tuo prossimo lavoro, ma vuoi partecipare alla costruzione di qualcosa di grande impatto, fianco a fianco con un team di talenti, sei nel posto giusto.

Di cosa ti occuperai
In qualità di Inside business Development Support (L.68/99), svolgerai un ruolo fondamentale nel garantire la qualità dei dati nel nostro CRM, supportando direttamente la crescita e l'efficacia del team Business Development di Napoli. Sarai il pilastro su cui si baserà la nostra strategia commerciale. Ecco cosa farai in una giornata-tipo:

  • Gestire e ottimizzare il CRM – Assicurandoti che le informazioni siano sempre complete, coerenti e accurate, pronte per essere utilizzate dal team.

  • Garantire la qualità dei dati – Scovando e correggendo duplicati, formattazioni incoerenti e informazioni incomplete per mantenere il nostro database impeccabile.

  • Arricchire le informazioni commerciali – Verificando che ogni contatto sia collegato all'azienda giusta e che i dati anagrafici (sito web, numero di dipendenti, settore) siano sempre aggiornati e corretti.

  • Supportare le strategie di vendita – Fornendo al team Business Development analisi e insight basati su dati puliti e affidabili, aiutandoli a prendere decisioni migliori e più rapide.

Aspettati sfide, collaborazione e la libertà di dare vita alle tue idee. Qui le cose cambiano rapidamente, quindi preparati ad adattarti, a prendere l'iniziativa e a dare forma ai processi di un team in piena espansione.

Chi stiamo cercando
Cerchiamo una persona precisa e con la stoffa del problem-solver, che ami lavorare con i dati e collaborare con il team. Se sei una persona curiosa e non hai paura di prenderti la responsabilità per garantire la qualità del nostro lavoro, sei esattamente chi vogliamo nel nostro team. Ti ci vedi?

  • Attenzione al dettaglio – Hai un occhio di falco per le incoerenze e ti appassiona l'idea di rendere i dati perfetti. Hai già lavorato con CRM o hai familiarità con la gestione di informazioni commerciali.

  • Approccio analitico e proattivo – Non ti limiti a eseguire, ma interpreti i dati per supportare le decisioni operative e proponi attivamente miglioramenti ai processi.

  • Dimestichezza con gli strumenti – Hai una buona conoscenza di Google Sheets o Excel, che utilizzerai per analizzare e sistemare i dati.

  • Spirito di squadra e voglia di costruire – Ti piace avere autonomia e responsabilità, ma anche relazionarti costantemente con il team per costruire insieme qualcosa di solido e scalabile.

  • Adattabilità – Ti trovi a tuo agio in ambienti in rapida evoluzione e non ti spaventa affrontare sfide nuove per contribuire a un team in crescita.

Non preoccuparti se non spunti tutte le caselle di questo elenco. Crediamo nel potere dei punti di vista e di forza di ognuno. Insieme stiamo costruendo qualcosa di speciale, e la tua prospettiva potrebbe essere l’elemento chiave che ci manca. Se sei una persona motivata e sai di poter fare la differenza, ti invitiamo a candidarti.

I benefit che avrai con noi
Crediamo fermamente che un grande impegno, sforzo e impatto meritino di essere ricompensati e supportati al meglio. Ecco perché abbiamo creato Satispay CareAbout, il nostro modo di assicurarci che tu abbia tutto il supporto necessario per il tuo benessere, la tua crescita e le tue finanze:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout: salute e benessere

  • Ferie illimitate

  • Congedo parentale esteso

  • Permessi per l’assistenza ai figli

  • Sistema di lavoro ibrido flessibile

  • Supporto psicologico e webinar con Serenis

📚 CareAbout: crescita e sviluppo

  • Programmi di sviluppo professionale

  • Programma di mobilità interna

  • Corsi di lingua con Preply

  • Esperienze di job shadowing

  • Workshop e training interni

💰 CareAbout: supporto finanziario

  • Stipendio competitivo

  • Budget extra per Flexible Benefit

  • Buoni pasto

Pari opportunità
In Satispay, siamo fieri di essere un’azienda che offre pari opportunità. Celebriamo la diversità e l'inclusione, accogliendo individui di tutti i background. Questa opportunità è aperta a tutti, indipendentemente da razza, colore, religione, sesso, identità di genere, orientamento sessuale e nazionalità. Unisciti a noi in un ambiente di lavoro dove tutti sono i benvenuti!

Scopri di più su di noi

I nostri valori e i nostri pilastri non sono solo belle parole su una pagina, ma plasmano davvero tutto ciò che facciamo. Esplorali qui.

Ti sembra il posto giusto per te? Fantastico!
Ci piacerebbe conoscere la tua storia.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Compliance Officer (Investment Products)

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What you'll be doing

As a Senior Compliance Officer (Investment Products), you’ll play a key role in ensuring our compliance with all applicable regulations, particularly within the investment products landscape. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Compliance Framework - Support the Chief Compliance Officer in implementing and maintaining a robust Compliance Monitoring Programme to ensure adherence to all applicable regulations. Perform second-line of-defense controls, highlight weaknesses, and issue recommendations.

jobs.title: Head of Fraud Strategy & Analytics
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Satispay

Satispay stands as a recognised leader in the European FinTech landscape, a company where a relentless drive for achievement is powered by a clear, impactful mission. We were born from a powerful vision to revolutionise everyday payments, making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Our strategic imperative is to continue shaping the future of money by simplifying complex financial interactions to profoundly improve people's lives.

As a high-growth scale-up, Satispay represents a dynamic environment at the forefront. Joining our team means stepping into a critical role with the authority and responsibility to drive significant business outcomes and shape the strategic trajectory of the company and the industry.

We are powered by a culture of ownership, relentless execution, and strategic foresight. We are brave in our approach, making courageous decisions and tackling challenges head-on, underpinned by a deep sense of responsibility for sustainable, ethical, and long-term success.

What you’ll be doing

As the Head of Fraud Strategy & Analytics, you will be the strategic "brain" of our entire FinCrime defense system. You will lead the analytical engine responsible for developing and optimizing the models, rules, and strategies that protect our platform and customers from fraud and other financial crimes in real-time.

This is a high-impact leadership role for a technical, data-fluent individual who thrives on solving complex problems and staying ahead of emerging threats. You will be instrumental in ensuring our risk management capabilities are not only compliant but also a competitive advantage.

In this role, embodying ownership and a commitment to craving impact, you will be expected to deliver significant results by:

  • Lead Detection Strategy - Lead the strategy, development, and optimization of our fraud and AML/CTF transaction monitoring systems across all products.

  • Collaborate with Data Science - Work directly with our Data Science team to design, build, test, and deploy sophisticated machine learning models for risk scoring and real-time fraud detection.

  • Own the Rules Engine - Take full ownership of the rules engine, working closely with the Transaction Monitoring Engineer to put rules in production and ensure maximum effectiveness and minimal customer friction.

  • Drive Proactive Research - Lead data-led research initiatives, using advanced analytical techniques to proactively identify new fraud typologies and emerging threats before they result in significant loss.

  • Monitor System Performance - Establish and own the key performance analytics for our detection systems, focusing on continuously improving metrics like True Positive Rate, False Positive Rate, and model accuracy.

  • Manage Technology & Vendors - Evaluate, select, and manage relationships with third-party technology and data vendors to enhance our prevention capabilities in areas like device intelligence, biometrics, and identity verification.

  • Provide Strategic Insights - Act as the key analytical partner to the Head of FinCrime and other senior leaders, providing actionable intelligence and strategic recommendations to improve our overall FinCrime framework.

You will lead and mentor high-performing teams, collaborate closely with peers with structured communication and transparency, demonstrating a commitment to integrity and ownership.

What we’re looking for

We are seeking a proven leader with a distinguished track record of success in driving strategic initiatives and achieving significant business growth within relevant sectors.

You will lead by example, combining ambition with purpose, drive impactful results, and cultivate ownership and continuous improvement in our dynamic environment.

  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related discipline.

  • 7+ years of progressive experience in fraud strategy, risk analytics, or transaction monitoring within fintech, payments, or financial services.

  • Proven experience leading analytical teams and setting data-driven strategy.

  • Deep, technical understanding of the fraud lifecycle and common typologies across various products (e.g., synthetic ID, account takeover, card fraud, bust-out schemes).

  • Hands-on experience with modern fraud detection platforms and rules engines.

  • Strong proficiency in SQL is essential; experience with a statistical programming language (e.g., Python, R) is highly preferred.

  • Excellent understanding of machine learning concepts and practical experience working with data science teams to implement models in a production environment.

  • A strategic, first-principles thinker with exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.

We recognise that exceptional leadership comes in many forms. If you believe you have the vision, experience, and drive to help us shape the future of money, we encourage you to apply. We value the unique perspectives and strengths that exceptional leaders bring, even if their experience doesn't align with every listed requirement.

Why this is your place

This is a unique opportunity to leverage your experience and leadership to make a profound impact on a company poised for significant future growth. We operate on a principle of reciprocity: significant strategic impact is met with meaningful rewards and opportunities.

  • Shape the future: Play a pivotal role in defining and executing the strategy that will propel Satispay to its next level of success in Europe and beyond, shaping the world of money.

  • Drive transformative impact: Lead critical functions and initiatives that directly contribute to our mission and impact millions of users and businesses.

  • Operate in high-growth: Thrive in a dynamic, fast-moving environment that demands bravery, resilience, and rapid, decisive action at scale. Experience the excitement of navigating growth where change is constant and the customer base/services are rapidly expanding.

  • Significant Equity participation: Directly share in Satispay's success through a competitive Stock Option Plan designed to reward leadership and contribution to company growth and raise the bar for collective success.

  • Lead exceptional teams: Build, mentor, and collaborate with high-performing teams in a culture of ownership, collective success, and continuous improvement fueled by feedback. You will learn from the best and lead alongside founders who are hands-on.

Our benefits & perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. Check out Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & wellbeing

  • Unlimited Paid Time Off

  • Extended parental leave

  • Childcare leave

  • Flexible hybrid work system

  • Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis

📚 CareAbout growth & development

  • Professional development programmes

  • Internal Mobility Program

  • Language classes with Preply

  • Internal workshops & training

💰 CareAbout financial support

  • Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)

  • Relocation packages

  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible Benefit budget

  • Meal vouchers

Equal Opportunity Employer

At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn more about us

Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Refuse to settle for the status quo.

Ready to take ownership of Satispay's boldest challenges and master impact at scale? Join us and leave your mark on the future of financial services.

Our strategic imperative is to continue shaping the future of money by simplifying complex financial interactions to profoundly improve people's lives.

As a high-growth scale-up, Satispay represents a dynamic environment at the forefront. Joining our team means stepping into a critical role with the authority and responsibility to drive significant business outcomes and shape the strategic trajectory of the company and the industry.

We are powered by a culture of ownership, relentless execution, and strategic foresight. We are brave in our approach, making courageous decisions and tackling challenges head-on, underpinned by a deep sense of responsibility for sustainable, ethical, and long-term success.

What you’ll be doing

As the Head of Fraud Strategy & Analytics, you will be the strategic "brain" of our entire FinCrime defense system. You will lead the analytical engine responsible for developing and optimizing the models, rules, and strategies that protect our platform and customers from fraud and other financial crimes in real-time.

This is a high-impact leadership role for a technical, data-fluent individual who thrives on solving complex problems and staying ahead of emerging threats. You will be instrumental in ensuring our risk management capabilities are not only compliant but also a competitive advantage.

In this role, embodying ownership and a commitment to craving impact, you will be expected to deliver significant results by:

  • Lead Detection Strategy - Lead the strategy, development, and optimization of our fraud and AML/CTF transaction monitoring systems across all products.

  • Collaborate with Data Science - Work directly with our Data Science team to design, build, test, and deploy sophisticated machine learning models for risk scoring and real-time fraud detection.

  • Own the Rules Engine - Take full ownership of the rules engine, working closely with the Transaction Monitoring Engineer to put rules in production and ensure maximum effectiveness and minimal customer friction.

  • Drive Proactive Research - Lead data-led research initiatives, using advanced analytical techniques to proactively identify new fraud typologies and emerging threats before they result in significant loss.

  • Monitor System Performance - Establish and own the key performance analytics for our detection systems, focusing on continuously improving metrics like True Positive Rate, False Positive Rate, and model accuracy.

  • Manage Technology & Vendors - Evaluate, select, and manage relationships with third-party technology and data vendors to enhance our prevention capabilities in areas like device intelligence, biometrics, and identity verification.

  • Provide Strategic Insights - Act as the key analytical partner to the Head of FinCrime and other senior leaders, providing actionable intelligence and strategic recommendations to improve our overall FinCrime framework.

You will lead and mentor high-performing teams, collaborate closely with peers with structured communication and transparency, demonstrating a commitment to integrity and ownership.

We are seeking a proven leader with a distinguished track record of success in driving strategic initiatives and achieving significant business growth within relevant sectors.

You will lead by example, combining ambition with purpose, drive impactful results, and cultivate ownership and continuous improvement in our dynamic environment.

  • A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related discipline.

  • 7+ years of progressive experience in fraud strategy, risk analytics, or transaction monitoring within fintech, payments, or financial services.

  • Proven experience leading analytical teams and setting data-driven strategy.

  • Deep, technical understanding of the fraud lifecycle and common typologies across various products (e.g., synthetic ID, account takeover, card fraud, bust-out schemes).

  • Hands-on experience with modern fraud detection platforms and rules engines.

  • Strong proficiency in SQL is essential; experience with a statistical programming language (e.g., Python, R) is highly preferred.

  • Excellent understanding of machine learning concepts and practical experience working with data science teams to implement models in a production environment.

  • A strategic, first-principles thinker with exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills.

  • Outstanding communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to translate complex data into clear, actionable insights for both technical and non-technical audiences.

We recognise that exceptional leadership comes in many forms. If you believe you have the vision, experience, and drive to help us shape the future of money, we encourage you to apply. We value the unique perspectives and strengths that exceptional leaders bring, even if their experience doesn't align with every listed requirement.

Senior Front End Developer - Tech Lead

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we’re just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you’re looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you’re in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As a Senior Software Engineer, you’ll play a key role in architecting and leading the development of a next-generation, highly scalable, and performant core frontend platform. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Provide technical leadership – Guiding and mentoring frontend developers, conducting code reviews, and leading knowledge-sharing sessions.

  • Enforce coding standards – Ensuring adherence to design patterns and best practices for frontend development.

  • Establish the technical vision – Setting the foundations for a scalable, maintainable, and high-performance UI platform

  • Evaluate and select technologies – Researching and choosing modern frontend technologies, frameworks, and tools.

  • Design scalable systems – Creating systems that support scalability and modularity to handle evolving business requirements.

Our frontend stack is built around TypeScript and React, with state management handled via TanStack Query, Zustand, and Jotai. We use Tailwind CSS and headless libraries like Radix UI or Base UI to power a modular, accessible design system shared across teams. Validation and functional programming are supported through Zod, fp-ts, and effect.

We also use GraphQL, Next.js in selected projects and AWS Lambda for serverless functions. Our testing strategy includes Vitest, React Testing Library, and Playwright for E2E testing.

Everything runs on AWS, with CI/CD pipelines managed via CodeBuild, CodePipeline, and GitHub Actions. Monitoring and observability are handled with Sentry and Kibana.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who we’re looking for

  • Extensive experience – 8+ years in front-end development, with at least 4+ years in a frontend architect or technical leadership role

  • Expertise in JavaScript frameworks – Proficient in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, and state management libraries like Tanstack Query

  • Experience with design systems – Skilled in using component libraries (e.g., Storybook, Headless UI, Tailwind CSS) and collaborating on UI/UX discussions

  • Strong understanding of build systems and APIs – Experienced with modern front-end build systems (Vite, Rollup, Nx/Turborepo) and deep knowledge of RESTful APIs, GraphQL, and WebSockets

  • Proficiency in production environments – Experience maintaining Node.js applications in production, including using observability/logging tools (e.g., Grafana, Cloudwatch, Logstash) and maintaining unit, integration, and E2E tests

  • Performance Optimization – Implementing techniques like lazy loading, code splitting, and caching to ensure optimal application performance.

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What you'll be doing

As an Incident Manager, you will be the cornerstone of Satispay's reliability and resilience. You are the authoritative leader during critical situations, ensuring our platform remains stable and trustworthy for millions of users. This role is crucial for protecting our user experience, maintaining business continuity, and driving the continuous improvement of our technology.

  • Lead and Orchestrate Incident Response: Take command during critical events from initial detection through to remediation. You'll be the central point of coordination, ensuring swift action, clear communication, and minimal service disruption.

  • Master Stakeholder Communication: Serve as the voice of the incident. You will deliver clear, timely, and accurate updates to leadership, technical teams, and business stakeholders, building confidence and ensuring alignment during high-pressure situations.

  • Drive Continuous Improvement through Post-Mortems: Lead blameless post-incident reviews to uncover deep-seated root causes. You won't just document what happened; you'll own the process of turning insights into actionable preventative measures, making our systems more robust.

  • Proactively Enhance Platform Stability: Go beyond reactive management. You will analyze monitoring data, identify trends and potential weaknesses, and work with engineering teams to prioritize and address issues before they impact our users.

  • Evolve Our Incident Management Framework: Refine and improve our incident management processes, tooling, and documentation to scale with our rapid growth.

Who We’re Looking For

We're looking for a leader who thrives in a collaborative environment and has a strong drive to solve complex problems. You take ownership when stakes are high and are passionate about system reliability. Does that sound like you?

  • Relevant experience: 3-5+ years of dedicated experience in Incident Management, Site Reliability Engineering (SRE), or a similar technical operations role, preferably within a high-growth tech or FinTech environment.

  • Strong Technical Acumen: You are comfortable in technical discussions about cloud infrastructure (we’re on AWS), microservices architecture, and CI/CD pipelines. You don't need to be a deep-coding expert, but you must speak the language of engineers.

  • Data-Driven Problem Solver: You have hands-on experience with monitoring, logging, and observability tools (e.g., Splunk, Datadog, Grafana, Prometheus) and use data to guide your analysis and decision-making.

  • Strong Communicator and Leader: You have a proven ability to direct technical teams during a crisis, brief executives concisely, and write clear, factual documentation.

Bonus Points:

  • Experience with regulatory or security frameworks like ISO 27001 or PCI-DSS.

  • Experience in building or scaling an incident management program from the ground up.

  • Relevant certifications (e.g., ITIL).

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

About Satispay
Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money. If you’re looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you’re in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As a Treasury & Safeguarding Manager, you will be a central figure in managing the financial heartbeat of the Satispay Group, reporting directly to the Finance Director. Your responsibilities will be structured around four key pillars:

  1. Treasury operations & investment management

    • Manage Group’s daily cash positioning: execute, settle, and reconcile treasury flows (SEPA, short‑term investments like time deposits and MMFs).

    • Oversee corporate and segregated portfolios, optimizing security, liquidity, and return per policy, and safeguarding; maintain segregated accounts.

    • Sustain cash flow via accounts receivable and collections; enforce robust controls over the movement and protection of safeguarded funds.

  2. Regulatory reporting & capital adequacy

    • Own regulatory capital: calculate, monitor, stress test, and report to ensure continuous compliance with prudential regulations.

    • Produce accurate, on-time regulatory statistics and financial reports for all relevant authorities.

    • Lead safeguarding governance: interpret requirements, track PSD2/E-Money and related EU changes, and update policies and procedures to mitigate risk.

  3. Financial analysis, accounting & closing

    • Develop and maintain cash flow forecasting models, preparing insightful analyses of actual vs. forecasted performance to support strategic decisions.

    • Contribute directly to the month-end closing process by performing monthly reconciliations of e-money liabilities and managing the accounting for all corporate bank and credit card transactions in our ERP system.

  4. Bank relationship & stakeholder management

    • Assist in managing relationships with our banking partners, handling due diligence and KYC requests, and sourcing new products to enhance our cash management strategies.

    • Act as a key treasury point of contact for other teams, providing expert support for new company projects and initiatives.

Who we’re looking for

We need a problem-solver who loves teamwork and gets things done. If you're curious and ready for real ownership, you'll fit in! Does this sound like you?

Proven expertise with treasury management systems, banking platforms, and SEPA instruments. Background in banking, particularly in back-office operations or financial product development, is a strong asset for future projects.

  • Strong technical and analytical skills. You are proficient in Google Sheets and Microsoft Excel, including complex functions, dynamic modeling, and dashboard creation. Experience with SAP accounting system is a significant advantage.

  • Structured communication and collaboration. You are fluent in written and spoken English. Skilled in engaging with various stakeholders to address inquiries and streamline processes effectively.

  • Regulatory Awareness. You have a solid understanding of financial regulations, especially SEPA compliance and PSD2 requirements.

  • Passionate and Adaptable. You are enthusiastic about the payment industry and thrive in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. You have a positive, can-do attitude and are always seeking opportunities to learn and grow.

Advanced Software Engineer, Back End Developer

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money. We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we’re just getting started.

We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go. If you’re looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you’re in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As an Advanced Software Engineer, Back End Developer, you’ll play a critical role in shaping the future of digital payments. You will be responsible for the technical direction, quality, and delivery of complex systems, impacting multiple services across teams. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Drive Multi-Service Solutions: Conduct technical analysis for medium-to-large projects impacting multiple services. You'll design comprehensive, highly-available solutions considering scalability, security, and maintainability for the overall product.

  • Ensure Technical Quality. You will implement robust testing strategies, balancing automation and manual coverage, and oversee gradual rollouts with careful monitoring.

  • Resolve and Anticipate Blockers: Proactively anticipates and resolves technical blockers, driving knowledge sharing across your organization. Ensures code quality through active review and mentorship.

  • Execution and Ownership: Take ownership of your work from start to finish, delivering features that truly meet user needs through seamless and efficient back-end integration across various departments.

  • Mentor Peers: Mentor and provide technical guidance to junior and mid-level engineers, actively contributing to their skill development and ensuring high-quality engineering practices across the team.

  • System Maintenance and Stability: Actively contribute to Satispay's mission by simplifying payments and improving accessibility through efficient back-end systems.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Our tech stack includes (but it’s not limited to) PostgreSQL, Java, Spring Boot. We rely on AWS for our infrastructure, with microservices deployed on EC2/ECS, S3 for storage, AWS Lambda for serverless functions, and Kinesis and ElasticSearch for log streaming. You'll take ownership of your work from start to finish.

Who we’re looking for

We need a proven problem-solver who takes initiative, excels in cross-team collaboration, and is a technical quality champion. Does it sound like you?

  • Extensive Experience: You have at least 5 years of related experience in back-end software engineering, with a proven track record of working with microservices, cloud environments, and Agile methodologies.

  • Programming Expertise: You have deep experience working with Java and a strong understanding of cloud platforms (AWS is a plus).

  • Technical Leadership: You have a proven ability to drive knowledge sharing, mentor peers, and conduct technical analysis for large-scope projects affecting multiple systems.

  • Structured Communication: You are able to communicate in a structured and convincing manner, adapting your style to build trust positively and professionally with various stakeholders, including coordinating implementation with other teams.

  • Passion and Language Skills: You are passionate about FinTech or startup environments and fluent in English.

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

jobs.title: Sales Development Representative Welfare, Napoli (L.68/99)
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Sales Development Representative Welfare 

📢 Promuoviamo la Diversità: Invitiamo le persone con disabilità a candidarsi! (L.68/99) 🚀

Questo ruolo fa parte del nostro impegno a promuovere un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo. Per questo motivo, Satispay dedica questa specifica opportunità a persone con disabilità o appartenenti ad altre categorie protette, in conformità con la legge italiana sulla tutela dell’occupazione (L.68/99). Accogliamo candidature da persone con ogni tipo di percorso.

Chi siamo 

Satispay è nata per rivoluzionare i pagamenti quotidiani, rendendoli semplici, giusti, e alla portata di tutti. Ora guardiamo ancora più in alto, con l'obiettivo di plasmare il futuro del denaro. Siamo un movimento che sostiene milioni di persone. E abbiamo appena iniziato. Ci muoviamo con velocità, pensiamo con audacia e ci fidiamo gli uni degli altri per sfidare lo status quo, imparando e crescendo lungo il percorso. Se non sei solo alla ricerca del tuo prossimo lavoro, ma vuoi partecipare alla costruzione di qualcosa di grande impatto, fianco a fianco con un team di talenti, sei nel posto giusto.

Di cosa ti occuperai 

In qualità di Sales Development Representative Welfare, sarai tra i primi membri del nostro team a Napoli, giocando un ruolo fondamentale nella creazione di nuove opportunità per i prodotti Welfare di Satispay. Ecco cosa farai in una giornata-tipo: 

  • Generare nuovi lead – Attraverso attività di chiamata a freddo, creando nuove opportunità di business. 

  • Sviluppare opportunità commerciali – Contattando figure chiave in aziende target per fissare appuntamenti di presentazione dei nostri prodotti Welfare. 

  • Collaborare con il Team Inside Sales – Contattando e coinvolgendo potenziali clienti per presentare inizialmente i prodotti Satispay. 

  • Costruire una solida pipeline – Alimentando il calendario dei colleghi del Team Inside Sales con lead qualificati. 

  • Contribuire al raggiungimento degli obiettivi – Organizzando il tuo lavoro per rispettare le scadenze e raggiungere i target mensili. Aspettati sfide, collaborazione e la libertà di dare vita alle tue idee. Qui le cose cambiano rapidamente, quindi preparati ad adattarti, a prendere iniziativa e a dare forma al tuo ruolo mentre cresciamo.

Chi stiamo cercando 

Cerchiamo qualcuno con la stoffa del problem-solver, che ami lavorare in team e mettersi all'opera. Se sei una persona curiosa e non hai paura di prenderti resonsabilità, sei esattamente chi vogliamo nel nostro team. Ti ci vedi? 

  • Attitudine commerciale e comunicativa – Con una forte propensione alle vendite e buone capacità negoziali e relazionali. 

  • Motivazione e adattabilità – Persona fortemente motivata, adattabile e pronta a mettersi in gioco in un ambiente dinamico. 

  • Capacità di comunicazione e collaborazione – Persona organizzata, fluente in italiano e inglese, con ottime doti relazionali. 

  • Orientamento ai risultati e proattività – Persona orientata al raggiungimento e al superamento degli obiettivi, con passione per il proprio lavoro. 

  • Pregressa esperienza commerciale – Anche breve, nel mondo delle vendite e con la capacità di ingaggiare potenziali clienti. 

Non preoccuparti se non spunti tutte le caselle di questo elenco. Crediamo nel potere dei punti di vista e di forza di ognuno. Insieme stiamo costruendo qualcosa di speciale, e la tua prospettiva potrebbe essere l’elemento chiave che ci manca. Se sei una persona motivata e sai di poter fare la differenza, ti invitiamo a candidarti.

I benefit che avrai con noi 

Crediamo fermamente che un grande impegno, sforzo e impatto meritino di essere ricompensati e supportati al meglio. Ecco perché abbiamo creato Satispay CareAbout, il nostro modo di assicurarci che tu abbia tutto il supporto necessario per il tuo benessere, la tua crescita e le tue finanze: 

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout: salute e benessere 

  • Ferie illimitate 

  • Congedo parentale esteso 

  • Permessi per l’assistenza ai figli 

  • Sistema di lavoro ibrido flessibile 

  • Supporto psicologico e webinar con Serenis 

📚 CareAbout crescita e sviluppo 

  • Programmi di sviluppo professionale 

  • Programma di mobilità interna 

  • Corsi di lingua con Preply 

  • Esperienze di job shadowing 

  • Workshop e training interni 

💰 CareAbout: supporto finanziario 

  • Piano di Stock Option (con aggiornamenti in base alla performance) 

  • Stipendio competitivo 

  • Budget extra per Flexible Benefit 

  • Buoni pasto

Pari opportunità 

In Satispay, siamo fieri di essere un’azienda che offre pari opportunità. Celebriamo la diversità e l'inclusione, accogliendo individui di tutti i background. Questa opportunità è aperta a tutti, indipendentemente da razza, colore, religione, sesso, identità di genere, orientamento sessuale e nazionalità. Unisciti a noi in un ambiente di lavoro dove tutti sono i benvenuti! 

Scopri di più su di noi 

I nostri valori e i nostri pilastri non sono solo belle parole su una pagina, ma plasmano davvero tutto ciò che facciamo.  Esplorali qui. 

Ti sembra il posto giusto per te? Fantastico! 

Ci piacerebbe conoscere la tua storia.

jobs.title: Senior Product Designer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
Senior Product Designer

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we're just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What you'll be doing

You are a strategic partner to the CPO tasked with tackling our most complex, cross-functional, and future-facing challenges. Here's what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Feature Design - Lead the end-to-end design of new features and products, from discovery to delivery.

  • Design System - Help grow and improve our design system to impact scalability and product-wide consistency.

  • Ownership - Drive the design lifecycle for key product areas with autonomy.

  • Strategic Impact - Act as a strategic partner, using design to influence product direction and business goals.

  • Influence&Mentorship - While not a people manager, you will be a mentor for the entire design team.

  • Elevating the quality bar - Act as a champion for design excellence. You will partner with our designers to drive strategic improvements, while also leading the exploration and adoption of new tools and processes, including AI, to increase our design quality and operational efficiency.

  • Data-Driven Design - Use qualitative and quantitative data to measure design impact and inform product strategy.

  • Accessibility & Inclusion - Stand up for accessibility and inclusivity, accounting for users with visual and motor impairments.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

Who we're looking for

We need a problem-solver who loves teamwork and gets things done. If you're curious and ready for real ownership, you'll fit in! Does this sound like you?

  • Senior Level Experience - 7+ years of product design experience, with a portfolio that clearly shows your leadership in shipping complex, large scale products and navigating systemic challenges.

  • UX Expertise - Deep expertise in UX principles and a proven ability to solve complex, ambiguous problems.

  • Tools Mastery - Expert-level proficiency in Figma and other modern design and research tools.

  • Communication - Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate design rationale and influence senior stakeholders.

  • Mentorship - Proven experience mentoring designers and contributing to a positive team culture.

  • Business Acumen - Strong business acumen and the ability to connect design decisions to business KPIs.

  • Autonomy - Pro-active and autonomous, takes initiative, and has skills in managing stakeholder relationships.

  • Bilingual proficiency - Professional proficiency in both Italian and English.

Don't worry if you don't tick every box. We believe in the power of different viewpoints and strengths. Your unique perspective is important as we build something special. If you're passionate and can make a difference, we truly encourage you to apply.

Our benefits & perks

We believe high commitment, effort, and impact deserve to be highly rewarded and supported. That’s why we created Satispay CareAbout, our way of making sure you’re supported in your well-being, growth, and finances:

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis

  • Flexible hybrid working system

  • Extended parental leave

  • Childcare leave

📚 CareAbout growth & development

  • Professional development programmes

  • Internal mobility program

  • Language classes with Preply

  • Internal workshops & training

💰 CareAbout financial support

  • Stock Option Plan (with additional grants often provided based on performance)

  • International relocation support

  • Competitive salary

  • Flexible Benefit budget

  • Meal vouchers

Equal-Opportunity Employer
At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, colour, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn more about us
Curious if our way of working clicks with yours? Our values and pillars aren’t just fancy words on a page - they really shape everything we do. Explore them here.

Sounds like your kind of place? Awesome!
We’d love to hear your story.

jobs.title: Junior Merchant Support Representative
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Satispay
At Satispay, we're not just reimagining payments; we're pioneering a movement toward simplicity and accessibility. Picture yourself at the forefront of innovation, leading the way in revolutionizing payments - and beyond! - across Europe, alongside a vibrant community of like-minded individuals driven by a shared vision: simplifying payments to improve everyone’s life.

Are you ready to be part of something bigger? Satispay is the place for you! Come be part of our dynamic team and help us shape the future of payments in Europe.

🚀 Join us as a Junior Merchant Support Representative and let's make magic happen together.

Role Overview
As a Junior Merchant Support Representative, you’ll be the first point of contact for our merchant base, helping them onboard and succeed with Satispay’s products. You’ll contribute directly to ensuring merchants have a seamless experience while learning the foundations of customer support, product, knowledge and problem-solving.

This role is about more than just answering queries - it’s about building trust with merchants, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and identifying opportunities to improve the way we work. You’ll progressively develop your technical expertise and autonomy, growing from ticket handling to basic support and troubleshooting.

Your mission:

  • Merchant Onboarding. Assist merchants during activation, ensuring they are equipped to use Satispay effectively.

  • Ticket Management. Handle a high volume of inbound tickets, responding promptly and accurately to merchant inquiries.

  • Active Troubleshooting. Address and resolve basic technical or operational issues (e.g. IBAN updates, reporting, payment acceptance guidance), escalating more complex cases as needed.

  • Technical Tools Usage. Use internal platforms such as Merchant Console, Business App, Dashboard, and documentation tools (e.g. Notion, Slack) with growing proficiency.

  • Collaboration. Work closely with teams such as KYC, Business Development, and Account Management to facilitate smooth onboarding and issue resolution.

  • Feedback Collection. Gather and share merchant insights with internal teams (e.g., Marketing, Product) to enhance our services.

  • Process Improvement: Identify recurring issues and suggest improvements to streamline merchant support operations.

Your ideal profile:

  • Proactive problem-solver and quick learner. A proactive attitude and strong computer skills, with the ability to take initiative in addressing challenges and learn new tools and systems quickly.

  • Detail-oriented and accurate. A detail-oriented mindset that ensures high accuracy in all tasks, especially when managing a high volume of tickets and handling technical details.

  • Clear communicator and adaptable. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for clearly explaining solutions, coupled with the ability to adapt quickly and work efficiently within tight timelines and changing priorities.

  • Collaborative and organized. Excelling at managing priorities, multitasking, and organization while enjoying a collaborative environment and embracing feedback for growth.

  • Service-focused and curious. Naturally curious and eager to learn, with a passion for helping merchants succeed and delivering exceptional service.

Don't let a checklist hold you back - at Satispay, we thrive on diverse perspectives and unique strengths. Your individuality could be the missing piece to our puzzle! Even if you don't meet every skill listed above, we encourage you to apply if you're passionate about the role and believe you can contribute to our team's success.

Contract and compensation

  • Fixed-term contract of 12 months;

  • Gross Annual Salary (RAL) starting from €26,000, in addition to the benefits listed below.

👨‍👩‍👧 CareAbout health & well-being

  • Unlimited paid time off

  • Psychological support & mental health webinars with Serenis

  • Flexible hybrid working system

  • Extended parental leave

  • Childcare leave

📚 CareAbout growth & development

  • Professional development programmes

  • Internal mobility program

  • Language classes with Preply

  • Internal workshops & training

💰 CareAbout financial support

  • Flexible Benefit budget

  • Meal vouchers

Our selection process is tailored to each role and includes at least a call with our Talent Acquisition Team, a technical evaluation, and a final in-person meeting. Your recruiter will share more insights during your first meeting with us!

Equal Opportunity Employer
At Satispay, we're proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and inclusion, welcoming individuals of all backgrounds. This opportunity is open to everyone, regardless - for instance - of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, and national origin. Join us in a workplace where everyone belongs!

Learn More About Us
Curious about our core values? Explore them here (link to values).

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

If you're looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you're in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As an Investment Products Development Associate, you’ll join our growing Investment Products division in Luxembourg, reporting to the Head of Satispay’s Investment Firm. You'll be a key senior member of this nascent division within the Satispay Group, playing an instrumental role in driving our ambitious plans to expand the scope of this business.
Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Lead the development and execution of new investment product initiatives - with a focus on simplicity, transparency, and user-centric design

  • Define, evaluate and pursue strategic business lines for potential future investment products offering - exploring areas such as crypto, thematic investments, pensions, trading platform, robo-advisory

  • Navigate and operate effectively within a regulated financial institution - balancing innovation with strong risk and compliance frameworks

  • Serve in management capacity of the licensed MIFID investment firm - ensuring adherence to all relevant regulatory obligations

  • Relationship building and stakeholder engagement - build and maintain relationships with key marketplace participants, including traditional investment and blockchain platforms and fund managers

  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams - (Product, Legal, Compliance, Operations) to bring new investment offerings to market

  • Act as a thought partner - on the long-term growth and direction of Satispay’s investment offering.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow.

We need a problem-solver with a strong analytical mindset who thrives in a collaborative environment. If you’re detail-oriented and ready to take ownership in a dynamic setting, you’ll fit right in! Does this sound like you?

  • Relevant experience – 5–10 years of experience in financial services, ideally in investment product development, strategy, or within a regulated investment firm.

  • Track record of successfully driving new business initiatives – from concept to execution.

  • Strong understanding of EU financial regulations – with direct experience navigating MIFID II frameworks and/or VASP/MiCA crypto framework; You are also familiar with regulatory regimes in Luxembourg and/or Italy.

  • Strong Interest or experience in digital assets or crypto markets – considered a strong plus.

  • Entrepreneurial mindset – with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving and decision-making – with a pragmatic approach to problem-solving and decision-making.

AI Solutions Specialist

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we’re just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

As a Fraud Data Analyst, you will drive strategic insight generation and operational excellence across our FinCrime and Compliance analytics landscape.   • Manage analytic solutions and outcomes – By modernizing, standardizing, and maintaining existing analytic solutions and tools used for FinCrime analysis, and by coordinating the creation of key data visualizations such as dashboards and reports to effectively communicate findings related to financial crime trends and risks.

  • Partner with data engineering – By collaborating closely with the Data Engineering team to define and continuously improve data structure, data pipelines, and visualization layers specific to FinCrime data, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency of our data infrastructure for fraud and AML/CTF analysis.

  • Enhance data-driven culture – By actively supporting decision-making processes within the FinCrime Operations and Compliance Department and promoting data literacy and proactive analytics across the FinCrime and Compliance teams through training and ad-hoc analytical support.

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life. Things change quickly here, so be ready to adapt, take initiative, and shape your role as we grow. 

Who we're looking for 

We need a problem-solver who loves teamwork and gets things done. If you're curious and ready for real ownership, you'll fit in! Does this sound like you?

  • Experience & Analytical Skills – 3+ years of working experience in Business Intelligence or Data Analytics roles, demonstrating strong analytical, statistical, and quantitative problem-solving skills applied to complex datasets and business challenges.

  • Technical Expertise – Advanced knowledge of SQL with a focus on query optimization for performance, extensive knowledge of Python or R for statistical analysis and data manipulation, and significant experience with data visualization tools such as Looker and Tableau.

  • Communication Skills – Ability to communicate complex data insights in a structured and convincing manner, building trust and fostering positive and professional relationships with various technical and non-technical stakeholders across the organization.

Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

  • Define Technical Strategy: Define the technical strategy for a domain area. You will architect complex subsystems with cross-product considerations and lead efficient initiatives impacting multiple groups.

Software Engineer Back End Developer

About Satispay

Satispay was born to revolutionise everyday payments – making them simple, fair, and accessible to everyone. Now, the focus has moved even further, aiming to shape the future of money.

We're a movement empowering millions of people, driven by a shared purpose to tackle big challenges. And we’re just getting started. We move quickly, think boldly, and trust each other to challenge the norm, learning and growing as we go.

If you’re looking for more than just your next job – if you want to build something impactful with a talented team – you’re in the right place.

What you’ll be doing

As a Software Engineer, Back End Developer, you’ll play a key role in shaping the future of digital payments by designing and building scalable, high-quality systems. You’ll be delivering features, gaining deep system context, and growing your technical expertise. Here’s what your day-to-day will look like:

 - Own the Story Lifecycle: Complete the entire story lifecycle from intake to production release. You’ll be responsible for standing up product stories and ensuring all requirements are met.

 - Contribute to Technical Excellence: Conduct technical analysis for standard scope stories and implement robust, scalable back-end solutions

 - Grow Technical Leadership: Begin to provide guidance and mentorship for peers and juniors, especially in technical implementation, while ensuring service/component-level technical vision is aligned with the roadmap.

 - Ensure Quality and Stability: Accurately estimate effort and resolve blockers promptly. You will participate in resolving incident resolution including root cause analysis and prevention, ensuring technical transparency across your scope.

 - Document and Communicate: Create comprehensive technical documentation for the features you build and collaborate with stakeholders

Expect challenges, collaboration, and the freedom to bring your ideas to life.

Our tech stack includes (but it’s not limited to) PostgreSQL, Java, Spring Boot. We rely on AWS for our infrastructure, with microservices deployed on EC2/ECS, S3 for storage, AWS Lambda for serverless functions, and Kinesis and ElasticSearch for log streaming. You'll take ownership of your work from start to finish.

Who we’re looking for

We need a problem solver who is eager to learn, owns their work, and is ready to collaborate and to take real ownership. Does it sound like you?

 - Experience & Technical Foundations: You have at least 3 years of industry experience working with Java and a foundational understanding of cloud platforms (AWS is a plus).

 - Teamwork and Communication: You are able to communicate clearly and professionally, contributing to team-level knowledge sharing and building trust with peers.

 - User Focus: Possesses an inherent desire to understand and address user needs, ensuring the back-end system supports a great user experience.

 - Passion and Language Skills: You are passionate about FinTech or startup environments and fluent in English.
